Dialogue:
BJ: Hello!  
BS: Hello! How can I help you today?  
BJ: How often do you watch TV?  
BS: Daily during breakfast and dinner.  
BJ: Do you have any favorite shows?  
BS: Yes, Kaji Yaro and Sekkaku Gourmet.  
BJ: You seem to enjoy comedians.  
BS: Yes, and I love food. Do you watch TV?  
BJ: Maybe once or twice a week.  
BS: Any regular shows?  
BJ: Wednesday Downtown.  
BS: The show at 10 PM?  
BJ: Yes, that's the one! Have you seen it?  
BS: Yes, it verifies theories and includes pranks.  
BJ: I enjoy those pranks.  
BS: Do you prefer pranks or comedians?  
BJ: I like both. Do you have a favorite comedian?  
BS: Yes, Sandwichman and Jiro from Sissonne.  
BJ: Great choices. Both are funny.  
BS: Sandwichman's hosting is stable and enjoyable.  
BJ: Their M1 win is always emotional for me.  
BS: I'll check it out. Any other favorites?  
BJ: Mr. Tanaka from Ungirls.  
BS: What do you like about him?  
BJ: His quirky characters and quick wit.  
BS: He's very talented.  
BJ: Brings back good memories.  
BS: Definitely. Anything else?  
BJ: No, that's it for today. Thanks!  
BS: Thank you!

BJ: Hi there!
BS: Hello!
BJ: I'm considering starting something new. What do you do on your days off?
BS: You've been visiting the library lately.
BJ: Yes, it's fantastic.
BS: There's a large library near my home.
BJ: Do you enjoy reading?
BS: Yes, I love books. Prefer paper ones.
BJ: I haven't read lately.
BS: Are there libraries or bookstores near you?
BJ: No, not really. What books do you like?
BS: Practical and self-improvement books.
BJ: Do you have any recommendations?
BS: "Tsumamimeshi" for easy cooking.
BJ: Never heard of it.
BS: Do you know Ryuuji?
BJ: Yes, Iâ€™m a big fan of his cooking videos.
BS: This is his recipe book.
BJ: The one who cooks while drinking?
BS: Yes, he's different on TV.
BJ: A helpful book.
BS: Quick recipes.
BJ: Is it at the library?
BS: Yes, they have it.
BJ: I want to visit the library.
BS: They also have magazines.
BJ: And it's free, right? A movie version would be great.
BS: They let you watch DVDs too.
BJ: I'll check it out. Thanks.
BS: You're welcome.

BJ: Hello!
BQ: Hello.
BJ: What do you do on your days off?
BQ: On my days off, I am mostly at home, often watching subscription services.
BJ: Oh, is it something like Netflix?
BQ: Yes. Recently, I've been trying U-NEXT.
BJ: I am also subscribed to U-NEXT. Do you like movies?
BQ: I'm not very knowledgeable about it, but I like it.
BJ: Have you watched anything recently on subscription services?
BQ: I watched "20th Century Boys" as a movie.
BJ: Oh, a live-action one?
BQ: Yes, the live-action version featuring Kenji-kun.
BJ: I saw it when it was first released. Was it interesting?
BQ: I watched it at the cinema and thought I wanted to see it again, so it was interesting.
BJ: It's nostalgic. If it's between Japanese and Western movies, is it Japanese movies?
BQ: I would say I watch Japanese films more, if anything.
BJ: Oh, then U-NEXT is good. It has a lot of Japanese movies.
BQ: The number of works is greater because it is more expensive than other subscriptions, right?
BJ: Yes, it will be cheaper if you share with your friends.
BQ: So there's something called 'share', huh? I didn't know that.
BJ: I think it can accommodate up to four people. The monthly fee can also be divided into four parts.
BQ: That's a good deal, right? Can you also read magazines?
BJ: Yes, for things like manga as well. Although, you mostly need points for them.
BQ: I see. Are you subscribed to any other services?
BJ: I am also subscribed to Netflix and Amazon.
BQ: Quite a few people have joined. I am subscribed to Disney Plus.
BJ: Disney Plus seems to have a lot of interesting content recently.
BQ: The short film of Baymax was interesting.
BJ: I didn't know such a thing existed. I would like to see it.
BQ: I recommend it.

BJ: Hello!
BQ: Hello, how can I assist you today?
BJ: What's your favorite food?
BQ: Pork cutlets.
BJ: Nice, I love them too! Do you prefer filet or loin?
BQ: I prefer roast.
BJ: Ah, I see. Filet? What about you?
BQ: Roast.
BJ: The loin seems more practical, right?
BQ: Yes, a good value.
BJ: What do you put on it?
BQ: Sauce.
BJ: Classic choice. Anything else?
BQ: What do you add?
BJ: I like sauce too, but salt is tasty lately.
BQ: Refined taste. I prefer grilled meat with salt.
BJ: That's new to me, interesting!
BQ: I usually eat it with sauce, but salt is good too.
BJ: I've only had it with sauce before.
BQ: What do you order first at a yakiniku restaurant?
BJ: Tongue.
BQ: Tongue is popular. I like it too.
BJ: Recently, I can't eat fatty things like kalbi much.
BQ: Understandable. Fat can be heavy. I often choose chicken.
BJ: True, chicken is good. Also, hormone dishes.
BQ: Are they tasty?
BJ: I like them, but tastes vary.
BQ: Which type do you like?
BJ: Hatsu and liver.
BQ: Classic choices.

BJ: Good evening.
BQ: Good evening.
BJ: Have you had dinner?
BQ: Yes, I had sushi from the supermarket.
BJ: Sushi is always nice.
BQ: It was quite tasty. What did you eat?
BJ: A Chinese rice bowl.
BQ: From a restaurant?
BJ: No, it was a ready-made meal. Not very good.
BQ: That's too bad. Do you like quail eggs?
BJ: Yes, there was a small one on it.
BQ: Ready-made meals have variety.
BJ: The quality is getting better. Convenience stores are impressive.
BQ: They develop their products well.
BJ: Do you eat them often?
BQ: I rely on them on my days off.
BJ: They're good. Seven-Eleven is my favorite.
BQ: I prefer Seven-Eleven but dislike false bottoms in packaging.
BJ: Prices have gone up recently.
BQ: Yes, prices have increased. Sometimes quantity decreases but price remains the same.
BJ: The fried chicken skewer was 180 yen.
BQ: That is surprising.
BJ: It was 100 yen when I was a student.
BQ: Coffee prices have also increased.
BJ: Really? I didn't know that.
BQ: About a 10 yen increase. Convenience stores are already pricey.
BJ: People still buy it.
BQ: As long as we can afford it. Price increases are tough.
BJ: Constant price increases are annoying.
BQ: They are. Price reductions are unlikely.

BJ: Good evening.
BQ: Good evening. How can I help you today?
BJ: What's something you want right now?
BQ: Possibly a car.
BJ: Any specific type?
BQ: Maybe a sedan.
BJ: Cars are convenient for many things.
BQ: Indeed. Is there a car you like?
BJ: Beetle Cabriolet.
BQ: Would you like more details on convertibles?
BJ: Are they fun to drive?
BQ: They generally offer a good driving experience.
BJ: How's their fuel efficiency?
BQ: Most modern convertibles are fuel-efficient.
BJ: Great. I hope you achieve your goal.
BQ: Thank you. I'll work towards it.
BJ: Good plan.
BQ: Thank you. Is there something you need?
BJ: Money.
BQ: Understood.
BJ: I'm planning to get married.
BQ: Congratulations. That requires planning and resources.
BJ: Yes, it's tough without enough money.
BQ: Are you concerned about costs?
BJ: Yes, including living expenses.
BQ: Starting a life together can be costly. Best wishes.
BJ: Thank you.
BQ: Finding a partner is important.
BJ: You will find someone great.
BQ: Thank you. Best of luck with your wedding.
